definition: to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send

sentences.english: Welcome to BeiJing, now let me introduce Beijng to you.
sentences.chinese: 歡送到北京，我來介紹北京給大家。

sentences.english: On the other hand welcome to the new job companion and the encouragement.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面臨於新來的工作火伴暗示歡送和鼓舞。

sentences.english: We gave them a warm send-off at the airport.
sentences.chinese: 我們在機場熱烈歡送了他們。

sentences.english: Cheers: Invincible being waved off in Portsmouth as it heads to the Falklands War
sentences.chinese: 人們在樸次茅斯歡送出戰馬島的無敵號。

sentences.english: Americans have bid a fond farewell to giant panda Tai Shan.
sentences.chinese: 美國民衆集體歡送大熊貓泰山。

sentences.english: We were given a great send-off at the airport.
sentences.chinese: 我們在機場熱烈歡送了他們。

sentences.english: He went rather than stay as an unwelcome guest.
sentences.chinese: 他走了，不願留上去做個不受歡送的主人。

sentences.english: They arranged a farewell reception for John, who had been transferred to the head office.
sentences.chinese: 他們爲升調到總部的約翰安排了一個歡送會。

sentences.english: The delegation was given a warm send-off at the airport.
sentences.chinese: 我們在機場熱烈歡送代表團。

sentences.english: We're planning a farewell party for you.
sentences.chinese: 我們準備給你開一個歡送會。

sentences.english: The band played the guests off.
Dance when you go to give her the send-off this night.
sentences.chinese: 當你今天夜裏歡送她的時候，舞動。

sentences.english: That morning, the company arranged a great banquet to send us off.
sentences.chinese: 這天早晨，爲了歡送我們，連隊大排宴席。

sentences.english: That would put Washington in the uncomfortable position of being a not-so-welcome suitor of China's men in green.
sentences.chinese: 這讓華盛頓進退失據，像一個不受歡送的青澀尋求者。
或許，給你辦一場歡送派對？

sentences.english: We held a big farewell party in honor of the Olympic team of China.
sentences.chinese: 我們爲中國的奧運“軍團”舉行了一個盛大的歡送會。

definition: to offer flowers/to lay flowers (as a memorial)
Double Tenth, the anniversary of the Wuchang Uprising 武昌起義|武昌起义[Wu3 chang1 Qi3 yi4] of October 10th, 1911/(Tw) National Day
to beat the gong to open a performance
